src:
Janja na Kitajskem kot doma
Nekateri so zanjo bolj zagnano navijali kot za kitajsko tekmovalko.
03 Nov 2019, 16:36 by T. J. G.



Janja in Urška na Kitajskem FOTO: URŠKIN OSEBNI ARHIV



Janja Garnbret je na zadnji tekmi svetovnega pokala v težavnostnem plezanju v Inzaiu osvojila drugo mesto. FOTO: MATEJ DRUŽNIK


Prejšnji teden je v mestu Xiamen na jugu Kitajske potekalo že četrto tekmovanje v težavnostnem športnem plezanju. Nastopilo je tudi pet Slovencev s svetovno prvakinjo Janjo Garnbret na čelu, ki je tam zelo priljubljena. Ima veliko oboževalcev in nekateri so zanjo še bolj zagnano navijali kot za kitajsko tekmovalko.


Janja Garnbret je na zadnji tekmi svetovnega pokala v težavnostnem plezanju v Inzaiu osvojila drugo mesto. FOTO: MATEJ DRUŽNIK

»To se mi je zdelo sila zanimivo, pa tudi to, da je marsikdo prvič slišal za Slovenijo prav zaradi nje. Sicer jo tam kličejo Janija, ker je besedo Janja pri njih težko izgovoriti,« je zapisala Urška Šimon, sicer iz Novega mesta, ki je še kot osnovnošolka vodila tudi oddaje na domačem, družinskem Radiu Sraka, v Xiamenu pa živi že osem let.
Na drugem koncu sveta ima ogromno oboževalcev.
Poleg Urške (na desni) in Janje Garnbret sta na sliki še gospod Guo in njegova hčerka Kumi, ki se uči risanja in angleščine v centru, kjer Urška poučuje. Oba sta velika Janjina navijača in tudi sama ljubiteljsko plezata kot presenetljivo veliko Kitajcev.
text:
Lambs in China at home
Some were more enthusiastic about her than for the Chinese competitor.
03 Nov 2019, 16:36 by T. J. G.



Janja and Urška in China PHOTO: URSKA'S PERSONAL ARCHIVE



Janja Garnbret finished second in the last World Cup in difficulty climbing in Inzai. PHOTO: MOTHER SOCIETY


Last week, the fourth difficulty climbing competition was held in Xiamen, southern China. There were also five Slovenians with world champion Janja Garnbret at the helm, who is very popular there. She has a lot of fans and some are even more enthusiastic about her than for the Chinese competitor.


Janja Garnbret finished second in the last World Cup in difficulty climbing in Inzai. PHOTO: MOTHER SOCIETY

“I found this force very interesting, as well as the fact that many people heard about Slovenia for the first time because of it. Otherwise, they call her Jani, because it is difficult to pronounce Janja's word, "wrote Urška Šimon, from Novo mesto, who also ran shows on the domestic Sraka Radio, as a primary schoolboy, and has lived in Xiamen for eight years.
At the other end of the world, it has a huge fan base.
In addition to Urška (on the right) and Lamb Garnbret, Mr. Guo and his daughter Kumi, who learns drawing and English in the center where Urška teaches, are also pictured. They are both big fans of Ioannina and also amateurishly climb as a surprising number of Chinese.
